security_audit.summary: Official Anthropic skill providing guidance and utilities for skill creation. All Python scripts perform safe file operations (directory creation, ZIP packaging, YAML validation) with no network access, command execution, or sensitive data handling.

content.user_title: Skill Creator - Build Custom Claude Skills
content.value_statement: Learn to create, structure, and package custom skills that extend Claude's capabilities with specialized knowledge, workflows, and tool integrations.
actual_capabilities: Provides comprehensive guidance on skill design principles and best practices
Includes init_skill.py script to generate new skill templates with proper structure
Includes package_skill.py script to validate and package skills into distributable .skill files
Includes quick_validate.py for validating skill frontmatter and structure
Teaches progressive disclosure patterns to manage context efficiently
Explains when to use scripts, references, and assets for different resource types
Provides workflow and output pattern references for common skill design scenarios
limitations: Focuses on skill structure rather than domain-specific content creation
Requires understanding of YAML frontmatter and Markdown formatting
Scripts require Python 3 environment with PyYAML library
Does not include automated testing frameworks for skills
Does not provide version control or dependency management guidance

use_cases.title: Package Technical Documentation Skill

best_practices: Keep SKILL.md concise - default assumption is Claude is already smart, only add what's truly needed
Use progressive disclosure: metadata ‚Üí SKILL.md body ‚Üí bundled resources loaded as needed
Match specificity to task fragility: high freedom for flexible tasks, low freedom for error-prone operations
Put comprehensive 'when to use' information in the description field, not the body
Split content into reference files when SKILL.md approaches 500 lines
Test all scripts by actually running them before packaging
Avoid duplication between SKILL.md and reference files - choose one location per piece of information
Use imperative/infinitive form in all skill instructions
Delete unused example files from initialized skill templates
Include table of contents in reference files longer than 100 lines
anti_patterns: Adding README.md, CHANGELOG.md, or other auxiliary documentation files
Writing verbose explanations when concise examples would suffice
Duplicating information between SKILL.md and reference files
Creating deeply nested reference structures (keep references one level deep)
Putting 'when to use' guidance in SKILL.md body instead of frontmatter description
Including untested scripts in the skill package
Overloading SKILL.md with details that should be in separate reference files
Creating skills without concrete usage examples first

faq.question: What's the difference between scripts, references, and assets?
faq.answer: Scripts are executable code (Python/Bash) for deterministic operations. References are documentation loaded into context as needed (schemas, API docs, guides). Assets are files used in output but not loaded into context (templates, images, fonts).

faq.question: When should I split content into reference files?
faq.answer: Split when SKILL.md approaches 500 lines, when supporting multiple frameworks/variants, or when content is only needed for specific use cases. Keep core workflows in SKILL.md and detailed specifications in references.

faq.question: How does the progressive disclosure system work?
faq.answer: Skills load in three levels: (1) Metadata (name + description) is always in context, (2) SKILL.md body loads when the skill triggers, (3) Bundled resources load only when Claude determines they're needed. This minimizes context usage.

faq.question: What should go in the frontmatter description?
faq.answer: The description is the primary triggering mechanism. Include what the skill does AND specific contexts/triggers for when to use it. This must be comprehensive since the body isn't loaded until after triggering.

faq.question: Do I need to include all three resource directories?
faq.answer: No, delete any unneeded directories. The init script creates examples of scripts/, references/, and assets/ to demonstrate structure, but most skills only need one or two of these.

faq.question: How do I validate my skill before sharing?
faq.answer: Run scripts/package_skill.py which automatically validates frontmatter format, naming conventions, structure, and completeness before creating the .skill file. Fix any reported errors and rerun.

permissions: File system read/write access for skill creation and packaging
